bib.title: Temporal changes in local topology of an email-based social network
bib.author: Juszczyszyn, Krzysztof and Kazienko, Przemyslaw and Gabrys, Bogdan and others
bib.abstract: The dynamics of complex social networks has become one of the research areas of growing importance. The knowledge about temporal changes of the network topology and characteristics is crucial in networked communication systems in which accurate predictions are important. The local network topology can be described by the means of network motifs which are small subgraphs--usually containing from 3 to 7 nodes. They were shown to be useful for creating profiles that reveal several properties of the network. In this paper, the
